What to pack for Colorado?

Colorado Experiences All Seasons

Peaks Recovery Centers List of Items to Bring

Peaks Recovery Centers are located in Colorado Springs, Colorado and experiences all the seasons. The staff at Peaks Recovery highly recommend packing accordingly when preparing to come to treatment. Peaks Recovery clients will also participate in outdoor activities as well as going to the gym. It is advised that the client brings approximately 2-3 weeks’ worth of clothes, including:

Clothing

  • Regular socks and a few pairs of wool socks for hiking
  • Underwear
  • Swimsuit
  • Gym clothes/ active wear
  • Comfortable pants and t-shirts/ loungewear/ pajamas
  • Short sleeved t-shirts and long-sleeved t-shirts
  • Tank tops
  • Sweatshirts/ sweaters
  • Pairs of jeans

Outerwear

  • Warm Winter Coat (Months: November - April)
  • Warm hat/ beanies (Months: November - April)
  • Snow and/ or winter gloves (Months: November - April)
  • Long Underwear - fleece lined or thermal
  • Backpack
  • Reusable Water Bottle

Shoes

  • Tennis Shoes/ Comfortable Walking Shoes
  • Sandals
  • Hiking Boots
  • Winter/ Snow Boots (Months: November - April)

Personal Hygiene

  • Shampoo/ Conditioner
  • Hairbrush
  • Body/ Bath Soap
  • Deoderant/ Antiperspirant
  • Toothbrush/ Toothpaste
  • Sealed Multi-Vitamins

Miscellaneous Items

  • Personal Keepsakes and Pictures
  • Blanked and Pillows - If Desired (Otherwise we provide these items)
  • Personal Electronics (e.g. phone and tablet). Client will have use of these items after approximately sixty (60) days and upon staff approval.

Items/ Clothing NOT allowed

  • Money
  • Cologne
  • Contraband - no weapons of any kind
  • Open supplements, herbs, laxatives or diuretics
  • Mouthwash (anything containing alcohol)

Admissions

  • Admissions Process
  • Verify Insurance
  • What to Bring

A Caring Recovery

A Caring Recovery for Young Adults

Get Help Today: (888) 506-9818

Everyday millions of individuals and their families are affected by substance use disorder. Studies show that the longer young adults participate in treatment programs and stay active in their recovery, the more likely it is that they will achieve long-term sobriety and stability. We believe it paramount to the long-term success of young adults and their recovery that they continue with extended care treatment. Our client’s personal growth and recovery from alcohol and substance abuse is our highest priority. It’s why we do what we do. At Triple Peaks and Serenity Peaks we value how special your loved one is and we are committed to their long-term recovery and personal growth.

Contact Peaks Recovery
